active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: Pair students: Partner A explains hash properties (preimage, second preimage, collision resistance) with examples; Partner B generates a SHA-256 hash for a sample file using sha256sum or Python hashlib and uses teach-back to verify Partner A's understanding.
active_learning.problem_solving: Provide sample software files (original vs. tampered). Students compute hashes to detect integrity breaches, then generate an SBOM snippet (SPDX or CycloneDX) including the hash. Extend to role-play: Simulate a supply chain attack (e.g., Log4j vulnerability) where hash mismatch reveals compromise; discuss mitigation.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding
